title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4115.2 - Powers of starter
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4115.2 - Powers of starter

State Regulations

The starter shall have complete control over all horses
participating in the racing program from the formation of the post parade until
the word "go" is given. The starter shall have authority to fine drivers not to
exceed $50 for violation of any of the following rules of the start: (a) delaying the start; (b) failure to obey the starter's
instructions; (c) rushing ahead of
the inside or outside wing of the gate; (d) coming to the starting gate out of
position; (e) crossing over before
reaching the starting point; (f) interference with another driver during the start; (g) failure to come up into and stay in
position. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4115.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
